servinfo.title: Cranking System Symptom Diagnosis
servinfo.ptxt: Possible symptoms due to starting system trouble would be as follows:

item.ptxt: Starting motor does not run (or runs slowly)
Starting motor runs but fails to crank engine

servinfo.ptxt: Proper diagnosis must be made to determine exactly where the cause of each trouble lies in battery, wiring harness, (including starting motor switch), starting motor or engine.
Do not remove motor just because starting motor does not run. Check the following items and narrow down scope of possible causes.

s1.ptxt: Tightness of battery terminals (including ground cable connection on engine side) and starting motor terminals

condition.ptxt: Motor not running – No operating sound of magnetic switch

ps.ptxt: Transmission range sensor is not in P or N, or not adjusted (A/T)

action.ptxt: Shift in P or N, or adjust sensor.

ps.ptxt: Malfunction of clutch pedal position switch (M/T)
Battery run down
Battery voltage too low due to battery deterioration
Poor contact in battery terminal connection
Loose grounding cable connection
Fuse set loose or blown off
Poor contacting action of ignition switch and magnetic switch
Lead wire coupler loose in place
Open-circuit between ignition switch and magnetic switch
Open-circuit in pull-in coil
Brushes are seating poorly or worn down
Poor sliding or plunger and/or pinion
Faulty starting motor control relay

action.ptxt: Control Relay Inspection:For Petrol Engine Model .

ps.ptxt: Faulty ECM and its circuit

action.ptxt: Inspection of ECM and Its Circuits:For Petrol Engine Model .

condition.ptxt: Motor not running – Operating sound of magnetic switch heard

ps.ptxt: Battery run down
Battery voltage too low due to battery deterioration
Loose battery cable connections
Burnt main contact point, or poor contacting action of magnetic switch
Brushes are seating poorly or worn down
Weakened brush spring
Burnt commutator
Layer short-circuit of armature
Crankshaft rotation obstructed

condition.ptxt: Starting motor running, but too slow (small torque) – Battery and wiring are satisfactory

ps.ptxt: Insufficient contact of magnetic switch main contacts
Layer short-circuit of armature
Disconnected, burnt or worn commutator
Worn brushes
Weakened brush springs
Burnt or abnormally worn end bush

condition.ptxt: Starting motor running, but not cranking engine

ps.ptxt: Worn pinion tip
Poor sliding of over-running clutch
Over-running clutch slipping
Worn teeth of ring gear
Abnormally worn bush
Worn pinion or worn teeth of ring gear

action.ptxt: Replace over-running clutch, flywheel (M/T) or drive plate (A/T).

ps.ptxt: Poor sliding of pinion (failure in return movement)
Worn internal or planetary gear teeth
Lack of oil in each part

condition.ptxt: Starting motor does not stop running

ps.ptxt: Fused contact points of magnetic switch
Short-circuit between turns of magnetic switch coil (layer short-circuit)
Failure of returning action in ignition switch
